availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Thomas Walter Campbell (Hopkins County clerk and soldier with the 25th & 17th Kentucky Infantry, 17th Kentucky Cavalry)

body.p: Kentucky clerk and soldier. Lived in Hopkins County, Kentucky in 1860. Married to Louisa Campbell. Father of Fannie Campbell and Emma Campbell. Served as a captain in the 25th Kentucky Infantry (Co. D), which was consolidated into the 17th Kentucky Infantry (Co. E), from January 1862 to March 1862. Commissioned a colonel for Hopkins County in 1863. Served as a lieutenant colonel in the 17th Kentucky Cavalry from April 1865 to September 1865.

bibl.p: Thomas W. Campbell, 25th Kentucky Infantry, Compiled Service Record, (https://www.fold3.com/image/231397170) (accessed on March 20, 2017); Thomas W. Campbell, 17th Kentucky Infantry, Compiled Service Record, (https://www.fold3.com/image/232365922) (accessed on March 20, 2017); Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1 (Frankfort: John H. Harney, Public Printer, 1866), 404-405, 423, and 958-959; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, p. 52.
